label: AB9C2_oC96_65_acg_ghoq3r_2g2h-001
title: BaIr$_{2}$Ge$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
\href{current_web_home_dir/AB9C2_oC96_65_acg_ghoq3r_2g2h-001}{BaIr$_{2}$Ge$_{7}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B16C4_tI46_139_ad_2ejm_g2-001}{Ba$_{3}$Ir$_{4}$Ge$_{16}$} are structures with the barium atoms surrounded by germanium rings and germanium-iridium cages.  They are superconducting at 2.5 and 5.2K, respectively. 
 (Ishida, 2014), wishing to present the structure with the long axis in the $\hat{z}$ direction, give the structural data for BaIr$_{2}$Ge$_{7}$ in the $Ammm$ setting of space group \#65. We used AFLOW to transform this to the standard $Cmmm$ setting.  This rotates the lattice 90$^\circ$ about the y-axis. In addition the origin was translated by 1/2\,b\,$\hat{y}$, moving the first barium atom from the (2b) site to the origin at the (2a) site. 
 The Ge VI and Ge VII (16r) sites are only half-occupied, leading to the observed stoichiometry.
